nodes.text: Welcome to the Disbarred Bards class, Mr. O'Conner. Not quite what you were expecting in a university devoted to heroism, is it?
Allow me to introduce myself... I am Joel Kyro. I am an entrepreneur of sorts. I, uh, buy and sell trinkets that might be of interest to you.
Good afternoon, Mr. O'Conner. Perhaps I might interest you in a few choice tools... or useful information?
Alas, poor Caesari has been rather testy since his little tete-a-tete with Esme the other night. It clearly did not go well for him.
I was wondering if perhaps you know what it was that displeased him so...
I hope the quiz today did not greatly disturb you. The Master frequently tests our wits and knowledge. This is just the first of the written exams.
Will you be joining us tonight in the Recreation Room after dinner for a few rounds of Poobah? It should be most amusing.

nodes.name: Poobah Tonight
nodes.description: There's a big game of Poobah in the Rec Room tonight. It might be a fun way to spend the evening.

nodes.text: I have been hearing from some of the people in other classes that there has been a series of minor thefts throughout the school. Interesting, is it not?
Mr. Terk seemed rather perturbed by all the thefts going around the school.
I am rather curious as to whether his indignation of such immoral activities exceeded his exhilaration at the possibility of disbanding the Disbarred Bards.
It was very good of you to catch the thief. It would have been most unfortunate if Mr. Terk shut down the Disbarred Bards class over this misunderstanding.
I find it interesting that Mr. Kent did not reveal the identity of the school Thief. Thomas is unfortunately very good at keeping secrets. I wonder what else he is hiding from us?
Ah, but I have added two more items to my little store. One is a rope and grapnel set that I believe will come in useful for... ah... extracurricular adventuring.
The other is an advanced lock picking gadget called the Houdini 42.
Since tomorrow is a day off from school, we will be having another Poobah game tonight in the Recreation Room. I do hope you will join in. The game will be much more enjoyable if you are there.
If you are interested in improving your Rogue... or Thief... skills, I just happen to have acquired something upon which you might be interested - the Trap Tapper disarm kit.
It will soon be the Midterm break and I will be going off on my investigations, so you might want to pick up a few incidental items from my supply.
I have a few new odds and ends that might intrigue you.
It seems as if Miss MacMichael is rather upset about something. Did she perhaps mention to you the reason that she is displeased?
I am happy that you did not fall into the trap that Caesari set for you yesterday.
You seem like such a nice person, Shawn, but there are times when I suspect that you are more than you seem to be.
You must not tease Sosi so... he is a very dangerous enemy.
I've done a little research on the sea caves over the holidays. I learned more about the pirate treasure that is rumored to be hidden there.
What did you think of today's lecture about Thieves and Ravens - interesting, no?
I cannot thank you enough for saving my life. You are an amazing person, Shawn O'Conner.
What do you think of the Nights of the Dead? After my unfortunate experience in the Catacombs, even the most benign of spirits give me the shivers.
I've always been rather fond of uncovering secrets. However, there are some secrets in this castle that even I do not dare to investigate.
These Dire Rats seem to be getting into everything. Something must have stirred them up.
Tonight will be the next-to-last Poobah match of the semester. I do hope you will be joining us. Caesari hopes to make a great deal of money on the game. I believe it will be quite the contrary.
We are almost at the end of the semester and the Rogue of the Year award. It has been a very exciting time at this school, don't you think?
I had a most interesting encounter in Caligari last night - and it directly affects you.

It is so very good to see that you have recovered from your almost certain brush with death. So very fortunate that I happened upon your broken and wounded body when I did... I shudder to think of what would have happened to you had I not found you.
Thank you...
Ah, but what else are true friends for?
